item.title: 丰田和日本的移民困境：外国人必不可少，但越来越不被接受
item.description:
在丰田市，移民为促进经济做出了贡献，同时也面临着政治上的反弹。【原文：

En la ciudad de Toyota, los inmigrantes contribuyen al impulso de la economía, al tiempo que se enfrentan a reacciones políticas adversas.

item.title: 加密货币 190 亿美元全军覆没显示出中心化的风险
item.description: 艾米丽-尼科尔（Emily Nicolle）从上周加密货币市场混乱的头条新闻中看到了风险。【原文：Emily Nicolle takes a look at the risk beyond the headlines of last week’s crypto market chaos.】

item.title: Medline 上半年净销售额达 135 亿美元，领先于 IPO
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Medline 将在首次公开募股时告诉潜在投资者，该公司 2025 年上半年的净销售额约为 135 亿美元，比去年增长约 9.7%。【原文：Medline is telling prospective investors in its initial public offering that it had about $13.5 billion in net sales in the first half of 2025, an increase of roughly 9.7% from last year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 赤字逼近，芝加哥将 RBC 信贷额度提高 1 亿美元
item.description: 芝加哥明年将面临约 10 亿美元的预算缺口，根据一份日期为 2021 年 12 月的协议修正案，芝加哥将与加拿大皇家银行资本市场（RBC Capital Markets）签订的循环信贷额度增加了 1 亿美元，并将到期日延长了两年多。【原文：Chicago, which faces a roughly $1 billion budget gap next year, has increased a revolving line of credit with RBC Capital Markets by $100 million and extended the maturity date by more than two years, according to an amendment to an agreement dating to December 2021.】

item.title: CEPU 签署谅解备忘录，帮助为 OpenAI 支持的阿根廷数据中心供电
item.description: 阿根廷最大的电力生产商 Central Puerto SA 公司签署了一份谅解备忘录，将为南美国家拟建的价值 250 亿美元的数据中心提供电力。【原文：Central Puerto SA, a top power producer in Argentina, signed a memorandum of understanding to help power a proposed $25 billion data center in the South American country.】

item.title: 特朗普警告将从波士顿撤走世界杯，从洛杉矶撤走奥运会
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统说，如果他认为波士顿和洛杉矶这两个城市准备不充分或条件不安全，他将寻求把 2026 年世界杯足球赛迁出波士顿，把 2028 年奥运会迁出洛杉矶。【原文：President Donald Trump said he would seek to move 2026 World Cup games out of Boston and shift the 2028 Olympics out of Los Angeles if he thought the cities weren’t properly prepared or if conditions were unsafe.】

item.title: 美联储主席柯林斯称 2025 年再降息一点是明智之举
item.description: 波士顿联邦储备银行行长苏珊-柯林斯（Susan Collins）表示，美国央行今年应继续降低利率，以支持劳动力市场，同时保持足够高的利率水平，以确保通货膨胀继续受到控制。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Boston President Susan Collins said the US central bank should continue lowering interest rates this year to support the labor market, while keeping them high enough to make sure inflation remains in check.】

item.title: 安大略省利用里根的旧演讲稿发布反关税广告，矛头直指美国共和党
item.description: 安大略省计划针对共和党控制的选区，利用已故总统罗纳德-里根（Ronald Reagan）的话，发起一场数百万美元的反对美国关税的广告宣传活动。【原文：Ontario plans to launch a multimillion-dollar advertising campaign against US tariffs, targeted at Republican-held districts and using the words of late President Ronald Reagan.】

item.title: 鲍威尔发出再次降息信号 就业疲软施压失业率
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示，美国央行有望在本月晚些时候再次降息四分之一个百分点，即使政府停摆大大降低了其对经济的影响。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell signaled the US central bank is on track to deliver another quarter-point interest-rate cut later this month, even as a government shutdown significantly reduces its read on the economy.】

item.title: Grindr 确认可能通过债务融资实现私有化计划
item.description: Grindr Inc. 表示，其最大股东正在探索以不低于每股 15 美元的价格将公司私有化的收购方案，这证实了此前媒体的报道。【原文：Grindr Inc. said its largest shareholders are exploring an acquisition to take the company private at no less than $15 a share, confirming an earlier media report.】

item.title: 布依格领导的财团提议收购 Altice SFR 大部分资产
item.description: 由 Bouygues Telecom、Orange SA 和 Iliad SA 组成的财团提出收购 Altice 在法国的大部分电信资产，企业价值为 170 亿欧元（197 亿美元）。【原文：A consortium made up of Bouygues Telecom, Orange SA and Iliad SA made an offer to buy most of Altice’s telecommunications assets in France for an enterprise value of €17 billion ($19.7 billion).】

item.title: 美国铝业要求限制部分废料出口
item.description: 美国铝业协会呼吁限制某些废金属，以增加国内供应。【原文：The US Aluminum Association called for restrictions on some scrap metal in an effort to bolster a domestic supply.】

item.title: 英国央行行长贝利对英国就业市场疲软表示担忧
item.description: 英国央行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）在华盛顿首次公开露面时对英国就业市场疲软表示担忧，称英国经济增长 "潜力不足"。【原文：Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey raised concerns about the softening in the UK jobs market during his first public appearance in Washington, saying the British economy was growing “under potential.”】

item.title: Binance 增加对在加密货币大跌中被清算客户的赔偿
item.description: 在对其在加密货币最大暴跌中所扮演的角色的批评日益增多之际，Binance 表示将向被迫清算的交易所用户额外发放 3 亿美元的稳定币，并提供 1 亿美元的低息贷款，以帮助 "受到严重影响 "的机构恢复交易。【原文：Amid growing criticism about its role in crypto’s biggest crash, Binance said it will distribute an additional $300 million in stablecoins to exchange users who incurred forced liquidations and provide $100 million in low-interest loans to help “severely impacted” institutions resume trading.】

item.title: 新加坡政府投资公司寻求赎回杰富瑞的 Point Bonita
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，新加坡主权财富基金要求从杰富瑞金融集团（Jefferies Financial Group Inc.【原文：Singapore’s sovereign wealth fund asked to pull some cash from a Jefferies Financial Group Inc. fund with large exposure to bankrupt First Brands Group, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中美边缘政策下，"TACO "贸易为何再次吸引投资者？
item.description: 10 月 9 日，中国宣布对稀土和其他重要矿产品的出口实施新的限制措施后，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普迅速采取报复行动，威胁要对从这个亚洲国家进口的产品征收 100%的关税。此举加剧了华盛顿与北京之间的贸易摩擦，并在金融市场掀起轩然大波。10 月 10 日，就在白宫提出全面征税后不久，美国股市创下了六个月来最糟糕的一天。【原文：After China on Oct. 9 unveiled new curbs on its exports of rare earths and other critical minerals, US President Donald Trump swiftly retaliated by threatening 100% tariffs on imports from the Asian country. The move exacerbated trade brinkmanship between Washington and Beijing and sent shock waves across financial markets. On Oct. 10, shortly after the White House proposed the sweeping levies, US equities posted their worst day in six months.】

item.title: Salesforce 称人工智能客户服务每年可节省 1 亿美元
item.description: Salesforce 公司表示，通过在软件公司的客户服务业务中使用人工智能工具，该公司每年可节省约 1 亿美元。【原文：Salesforce Inc. said it’s saving about $100 million a year by using artificial intelligence tools in the software company’s customer service operations.】

item.title: 特朗普的木材关税来了。谁受到的冲击最大
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布对进口木材和木制品全面征收关税，他的政府称这是保护美国经济和促进国内制造业发展的需要。从 10 月 14 日起，软木木材将面临 10% 的关税，而厨柜、浴室柜和其他木制成品将被征收 25% 的关税，并在 1 月份进一步提高。【原文：President Donald Trump unveiled sweeping tariffs on imported lumber and wood products that his administration says are needed to protect the US economy and boost domestic manufacturing. As of Oct. 14, softwood lumber faces 10% duties, while kitchen cabinets, bathroom vanities, and other finished wood goods are subject to 25% tariffs that rise further in January.】

item.title: Spotify 将开始在 Netflix 上播放视频播客
item.description:
Spotify Studios 和 Ringer 的某些节目（包括 Bill Simmons 的播客）将于明年开始同时在这两项服务上发布

。【原文：

Certain shows from Spotify Studios and the Ringer, including Bill Simmons’ podcast, will begin publishing simultaneously on both services next year

】

item.title: 美国制裁从美国受害者手中窃取数十亿美元的网络骗子
item.description: 特朗普政府制裁了东南亚一百多家与在线投资骗局有关的公司和个人，这些骗局近年来骗取了美国受害者数十亿美元。【原文：The Trump administration sanctioned more than a hundred companies and individuals in Southeast Asia linked to online investment scams that have fleeced US victims of billions of dollars in recent years.】

item.title: 米莱团队在特朗普会晤前发出混合外汇政策信号
item.description: 阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱伊（Javier Milei）的放松管制沙皇表示，随着阿根廷目前的贸易范围扩大，阿根廷将 "很快 "实行浮动汇率。【原文：Argentina will have a floating exchange rate “pretty soon” as its current trading band widens, according to President Javier Milei’s deregulation czar.】

item.title: 自由港将摆脱数十年来设定的铜基准
item.description: 自由港麦克莫兰公司（Freeport McMoRan Inc.【原文：Freeport McMoRan Inc. plans to break away from the benchmark pricing system underpinning global sales of mined copper ores to protect the profitability of smelters, the company’s top commercial executive said in an interview.】

item.title: 加密货币跌势加深，以太币有陷入熊市的风险
item.description: 就在两个月前，围绕以太坊（Ethereum —区块链）的热情还在向主流市场蔓延。以太坊的原生代币以太币（Ether）飙升至四年来的最高点，因为投资者既将其视为一种货币，也将其视为对以太坊在支付和金融领域日益重要作用的押注。华尔街的交易员们正在围绕以太坊构建基金，而环球银行金融电信协会（SWIFT）与以太坊挂钩的分类账试点似乎也证实了以太坊作为现实世界基础设施的到来。【原文：Just two months ago, enthusiasm around Ethereum — the blockchain that powers a key corner of the crypto economy — was spilling into the mainstream. Its native token, Ether, had surged to a four-year high as investors treated it as both a currency and a bet on the network’s growing role in payments and finance. Wall Street desks were structuring funds around it, and SWIFT’s pilot of an Ethereum-linked ledger seemed to confirm its arrival as real-world infrastructure.】

item.title: 意大利将削减中产阶级所得税，耗资 90 亿欧元
item.description: 意大利最新的预算案将减轻中产阶级收入者的负担，使总理乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）能够在三年内花费约 90 亿欧元（105 亿美元）兑现她对选民的承诺。【原文：Italy’s latest budget will ease the burden on middle-class earners, allowing Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni to keep her promise to voters at a cost of about €9 billion ($10.5 billion) over three years.】

item.title: 西方石油公司首席执行官霍鲁布认为 2026 年前油价区间紧张
item.description: 西方石油公司（Occidental Petroleum Corp.首席执行官维基-霍鲁布（Vicki Hollub）周二在伦敦能源情报论坛上说，她认为到2026年，石油价格将在每桶58美元至62美元之间。【原文：Occidental Petroleum Corp. Chief Executive Officer Vicki Hollub sees oil pricing between $58 and $62 a barrel through 2026, she said Tuesday at the Energy Intelligence Forum in London.】

item.title: 维勒鲁瓦称法国需要 "大幅 "削减赤字
item.description: 法国央行行长表示，法国必须大幅削减开支，以帮助减少预算缺口，而预算缺口正在加剧政治动荡，并使债券市场岌岌可危。【原文：France must make major spending cuts to help bring down a budget shortfall that’s fueling political turmoil and rattling bond markets, its central-bank governor said.】

item.title: StubHub 分析师看好该股。市场尚未信服
item.description: StubHub Holdings Inc. 在上个月以 8 亿美元首次公开募股后，其股价能否从亏损中恢复过来，取决于该票务销售平台明年能否在销售额和利润率方面实现曲棍球棒般的增长。【原文：StubHub Holdings Inc.’s hopes of its stock recovering from its losses after last month’s $800 million initial public offering depend on the ticket-selling platform coming through with hockey stick-like increases in sales and profit margins next year.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长科切尔：在泡沫风险下不会过多放松管制
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员马丁-科切尔建议，鉴于市场背景，目前不要采取过于激烈的行动来放松银行监管。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Martin Kocher advised against too drastic a move to loosen bank regulation at present, given the market backdrop.】

item.title: 鲍威尔称美联储未来数月可能停止缩减资产负债表
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示，央行可能在未来几个月内停止缩减资产负债表。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell signaled the central bank may stop shrinking its balance sheet in the coming months.】

item.title: 维勒鲁瓦称欧洲央行下一步行动更可能是减息而非加息
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）表示，欧洲中央银行下一步更有可能降低利率，而不是提高利率。【原文：The European Central Bank is more likely to lower interest rates than raise them as its next move, according to Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau.】
